Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: daisy l
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a university trip in April 2011, it was ok to just sleep in but has a huge fence surrounding it and seems like a prison. To get to central Rome was a nightmare wouldn't even call it close! the metro is a 20 minute taxi ride away and it costs a fortune just to get there, the nearby town is terrifying and you have to cross a busy motorway just to get there. There is no where to eat nearby and the food in the hotel is awful!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “worked here !!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1nico
Reviews.Content: Never had such a laugh in all my days , rather like being on the film set of faulty towers !!! What you have to remember is... when in Blanc et Noir, do as the Blanc et Noir do and dont offend the staff !!!! nothing has changed since the early 90 S when i was there and i f you ve been camping you should cope well with a bit of muck and caos !!!!!! Remember, like all things in life , its what you make of your stay that counts and to be honest there s nothing at this hotel than can detract from a stay in the stunning roma !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: turquoise80
Reviews.Content: Like a jail! It was one of the worst hotels I have ever seen... I had to sty there as I was on business trip and there were no other options around this area but instead of staying there I would prefer to stay far far away... People at the reception were rude, the room was dirty and I couldn't even open the blinds as I was directly on the ground floor facing a dirty area. They charged 90Euro fur such a bad room, service and location... Don't go there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really terrible!”
Reviews.Author: RFreed
Reviews.Content: Pls, avoid this hotel if you can! It is really far from city centre and without any kind of public transportation useful to reach it. And there was a tough road to reach it. The hotel is quite old-fashioned (but it can depend of personal preferences) but I think that we all agree that broken air conditioning system, dry and old bread, limited breakfast selection and poor food quality (we are in Italy!!), broken shutter and... 2 beetles below the bed has been really enough! Do consider the amount paid, I strongly do not reccomend this hotel. I have already complained with the tour operator, Europamundo, hoping they won't carry anymore other people there!

Reviews.Title: “I got lucky”
Reviews.Author: misscan
Reviews.Content: My roomie and myself got extremely lucky with this hotel. Everything was fine in our room, it was clean and beds were fine. BUT.... friends in another room had problems with their shower -- it wouldn't turn off! Another friend got MANY bites either from bed bugs or mosquitos that came into the room at night. Location was so-so. In order to get back to the hotel from central Rome, you had to take the metro and then take a bus (I think its number 33) and after that its about a 5 minute walk. My advice -- watch out with this hotel, its really a hit or miss.

Reviews.Title: “The Shining”
Reviews.Author: kec59
Reviews.Content: Mold growing on the ceilings of the rooms. We were a group of 43.....so we saw a lot of rooms. Toilets were loose, bathtubs leaked with exposed wires. Ground -1 level had a open room that had liquor botttles, pop bottles and other debris along with all the exposed wiring. Stain carpet was in several of the rooms and the hall. The 4th floor was called "The Shining" by our group. Lightbulbs hanging by wires in the hallway, electrical tape wound around wires attached to the button to turn the hall light on. We weren't lodged on the fourth floor but if you took the stairs you got mixed up on which floor was 3 and climbed up to 4th floor by accident. Continental breakfast was marginal but the cooles place in the hotel. Air condiditoning only worked in part of the rooms so we moved into each other rooms where the cooling worked part of the time vs. never.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ruin your trip”
Reviews.Author: francisUS
Reviews.Content: Don't ruin your trip to Rome by staying here. If you like decor in your room that dates back to when Mussolini was in power, then this is the place for you! The carpet in our room was not clean. My wife and I were given three small twin beds to sleep on. The room smelled like my grandmother's coat closet. The light fixture in the middle of the ceiling was hanging from wires. The phone outlet was hanging out of the wall and there was no phone in the room. The chain on the door was broken and consisted of what looked like three paper clips strung together. I had to slam my door to get it to shut. There were many holes in the walls and a couple of big smudges on the wall also; one of the smudges looked like blood. The television was very small and had little or no reception on every channel. The walls were paper thin and I enjoyed listening to the two old ladies talking all night in the room next door. We also enjoyed the noise of people outside our window as their tour buses would pull up and they would empty out of the bus under our window and talk for hours. This was possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Don't do it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Student Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandra_de_jong
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. The first night, it was ok. No problems.. only for our travel agent Marianne. She stayed there for 3 weeks, and every week she had to move to another room. Now.. she had the most terrible room ever. I thought it was very sad. Also becouse our travelagensy "Kras" didnt do anything about it. Luckely she did go home to Holland with us today, so she can finally get some rest. The second night was one hell. Full busses arived with school childeren. And... they make a lot of sound. and that also for the 3 and 4th night. Very bad... and also... there is nothing to do at the hotel. nothing. The pool was closed... and there is only one bar. but the waiter was nice.... The beds are good, every day the make up your bed. Every day i have clean towels. That is the only good thing of the hotel. But our travel agent Marianne.. she did the best she can. She showed us rome... with all her energy. but next time.. i will take a nother hotel...

Reviews.Title: “If You Can Find It”
Reviews.Author: rdclarke
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms were very large and generally clean. The decor wasn't especially new but not too bad. Most of the rooms had a balcony but nothing special (most views were of neighboring apartments). I believe the TV was available if you paid extra. We stayed with a group and some rooms had air conditioning but our did not. It wasn't too hot at night but during the day it would be. There is a pool on the property with a refreshment stand there. It was a very quiet and relaxed place and the service was very good. They spoke English well and were happy to accomodate our requests. The breakfasts were typical Italian (buns, cereal, yogurt, coffee and juice). It was very difficult to find and it took our driver about 45 minutes with the help of our guide (who lives in Rome) and GPS. It is about a 20min. drive to central Rome and is in a not so nice area. As a tourist, I wouldn't stay here again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised!! We had already booked this hotel before we read the previous trip advisor reviews. So we were not expecting the hotel to be up to much. But, the rooms were tidy and were cleaned with fresh towels everyday. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. The breakfast was continental and adequate. Unfortunately, the downside of this hotel was the location and the links with public transport. Be prepared for a lot of walking and the steep hill outside the hotel. All this aside, this is a cheap hotel and you get what you pay for!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A good budget hotel if you don't mind using public transport. Good: low price, nice rooms, quiet location with a nice view Bad: in the middle of nowhere, often crowded with school and tourist groups, decent bus service crawls into town at rush hour

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in Hotel Blanc et Noir. We travelled to Rome by car and we searched 2,5 hours to find the hotel!! It is really hard to find and not quite what you expect to see. We drove along the hotel twice and the third time we realised the hotel was behind a big fence. When we saw the horrible entrance and thougth of the shocking revieuws on this site, we were really scared that we've booked the worst hotel ever. But behind the fence it was not that bad. Our room was clean (there were certainly no bugs in the bed!!) and the swimmingpool was nice. The breakfast was not so nice, the bread was only fresh on Monday and the cheese was very sweaty. Please take this tip: if you drink the coffee (which I would not suggest) fill it for 1/2 with milk. You might get sick if you drink it black.. Anyway, we think the most important thing is that the rooms are clean and what can you expect in such a cheap hotel ?

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to Rome for a short break recently. After searching the web for good deals, we stumbled across the Blanc Et Noir Hotel in Rome. Once booked, I then stumbled across the reviews on expedia, and have to admit to being alarmed, however as the hotel was now paid for and non-refunable we thought it best to give it a try. Upon arriving in Rome, we asked for directions and set off to find the hotel. After a train ride, a bus and then a long walk up a hill we found it - a broken sign and big black iron gates. After the initial panic, we realised it was not quite as bad as first thought. The hotel was pretty basic, and seemed to be stuck in an 80's timewarp but the rooms were clean and fairly comfortable (although twin beds was not ideal for a romantic break, especially after booking a double). Breakfast however was not great, there was a large number of school children staying at the same time and they overtook the restaurant so we hardly had a look in. The other downside was that the children had no respect for any one else staying in the hotel. As we got a cheap deal, our room was situated in the same coridoor as most of the kids and 2 of the 3 mornings we were woken ealrly by slamming doors and noise in general. The hotel did not seem to be concerned about this, and the impression we got was that they did not care an awful lot once they had your money. Overall, the hotel was OK but it was too far out of the way for a long stay. Ideal if you are on a budget but not if you are looking for some luxury or a romantic break in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Travelling into the centre of Rome was such a chore!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Rome and we found this hotel extremely unnerving. It spoilt our trip as apart from it we loved our visit. Most of the locals were ok. We nearly decided to cut our holiday short and come back early as we were so distressed at one stage. There were damp patches on the walls which we noticed straight away but we were willing to make the best of it. Directions for travel into Rome were placed at the reception and a paid-for photocopy would have helped but you didn't like to ask because they didn't appear that helpful. We struggled to get into Rome and we have travelled all over the world and never had such trouble getting into the centre before. We had to take a taxi to the hotel the first night as we found it extremely difficult to reach by ourselves and the locals didn't seem to know it's location either. We were quite shocked when we arrived at the entrance that the taxi driver took us to as the sign was broken and it didn't look like a proper hotel entrance. I, being a female, was quite frightened! Once inside the hotel grounds we found that you had to press a buzzer to be allowed outside. We found that a bit unnerving at first as no one told you anything about the procedure. The other entrance was on to a dual carriage-way which was inconvenient. The Number 31 bus that they suggested from this stop took ages the first morning and we didn't use it again. It took us until the fourth night of our stay for us to get used to getting into and out of Rome in a reasonable amount of time. We even went into a tourist information bureau in Rome and asked their assistance and they suggested using three buses and changing twice! However the best way we found eventually was to take the No 8 tram to Travestevere Station and then a 786 bus and get off at the bus stop just after the sign for the European Hospital. Beware though that the Tram No 8 doesn't announce stops inside as usual and there are no notices for stops even if you try to look through the tram windows. Counting the number of stops from the centre was the only way that we coped. We had one dreadful night due to this problem and our determination not to take another taxi. Also as a result you had to leave Rome fairly early at night. If only we had known this at the beginning! My husband had bites on his legs but we found the breakfast OK although there were lots of chinese coach groups and it was best to get up early or supplies of food decreased. The decor was mainly shades of antique gold but quite clean apart from the damp patches on the walls. The shower worked quite well and the maid cleaned and supplied free toiletries regularly. Their electrical sockets only had a shaver socket if you wish to use a mobile phone charger. We had one that we had used before in Italy but had to get an extra attachment from an electrical shop near St. Peter's. You had to go through the entrance with a broken sign and pass the abandoned car down to a tobacconist on the left in a group of shops to get a bus ticket for the centre. The best one was a daily one which allowed you to use all the forms of transport for a day. However there was a special bus one that you could use for 75minutes. The dual carriage way was unnerving for a few days as you felt cut off until you realised that there was normal town life a little further down on the left under the bridge and past the garage.

Reviews.Title: “It ain't that bad!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before I went to Rome with 24 other student I read these reviews and was kinda shocked. Will this be the place I have to spend a whole week?! So I spoke to someone who organised the trip and she told me everything was ok. So still sceptical we went... Now I'm a back home and first thing I have to say that's there was nothing wrong with the hotel. Although it is far from the centre of Rome (first bus and then with the metro -> +/- 30-45 minutes total) and at night you have to go back with a taxi (+/- 20 euro's), the hotel itself isn't bad at all. It's not the most luxurious hotel you have been probably, but there are no bugs in the bed, didn't have a problem with the staff and for breakfast there was bread (globules?), croissants, cereal, yoghurt etc. If you want a cheap hotel, and you don't mind the distance, it's ok to stay here! (just go around 9 till 2 o'clock at night to Rome, centre; there's enough to see!)

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is crap!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel was the worst hotel i have ver been too. The staff were rude and stole things from rooms. One person on my trip got 80 euro stolen form them the other got a whole bag of clothes stolen. the rooms were smelly and mold on the walls, bugs in the beds, you would wake up and have bites on your legs. It got to the point where you couldnt even sleep in the bed. The staff at the fornt desk are sooo rude. if your not wearing shoes in the lobby they yell at you in italian, and if u lock your self out of your room they yell at you. we went with a group of 30 students and they said they would call the police if we were loud again. it is in a residential area so you have ot take a bus and two subways to get into downtown rome.its an experience to stay in the residential area, kinda a problem to get into the nice parts. dont stay here if you wnat a really good hotel. Oh and the food sucked! breakfest is bread that is left out the nite before. there are some good pizzareias near buy though and cheap stores

HotelInfo.Name: Park Hotel Blanc et Noir
HotelInfo.Address: Via Alberese, 38,, 00149 Rome, Italy
